item.title: Report X-2024091268
item.description:
Report X-2024091268

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-24T09:21:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Corrosive hazmat package was found wet & torn. Upon inspection found 1 bottle of Quali-Pro ethephon 2SL plant growth regulator 2.5-gallon had large dent on side of bottle & loose lid resulted to leakage. Package is a undeclared hazmat due to labels covering the corrosive hazmat diamonds on outer packaging & no certificate was attached.

item.title: Report E-2024090407
item.description:
Report E-2024090407

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-09
  • City: SANTA ROSA BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 9, 2024, five (5) five-gallon pails of primer were dropped during unloading and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of primer to the asphalt. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from NRC Gulf Environmental Services, Inc. (NRC Gulf) to remediate the impacted site. NRC Gulf placed all damaged pails into seven (7) lined 55-gallon drums. Granular absorbents were placed onto all primer impacted areas. The crew swept up all loose absorbents with hand tools. A pressure washing system was used on all stained concrete and a vac truck was utilized to retain any loose water. All seven (7) waste drums were taken offsite and staged at the Milton, Florida R+L terminal. All waste water was taken with the crew to be disposed of on a later date.

item.title: Report E-2024090415
item.description:
Report E-2024090415

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-28
  • City: HIALEAH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 21:15 EST 8/28, XPO-NMF contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 1 qt of Isopropyl Alcohol from a 55-gallon metal drum. A forklift punctured the drum, spilling it on the NMF dock. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller, who felt comfortable cleaning the spill with terminal-issued PPE. The damaged drum and cleanup debris were containerized in in 65-gallon poly drum which was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.
